intro: Czernaevia laevigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf czernaevia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
